skill.name: slack-gif-creator
skill.description: Knowledge and utilities for creating animated GIFs optimized for Slack. Provides constraints, validation tools, and animation concepts. Use when users request animated GIFs for Slack like "make me a GIF of X doing Y for Slack."

skill.author: unspecified

security_audit.summary: This is an official Anthropic skill, so a minimal audit is required. No security issues were identified in the reviewed files.

content.value_statement: Need a small, smooth GIF that fits Slack limits. This skill builds and validates optimized GIFs with easing and frame helpers.
actual_capabilities: Build GIFs from PIL or numpy frames with size normalization
Quantize colors with optional global palette for smaller files
Remove near-duplicate frames by similarity threshold
Optimize for Slack emoji sizing and reduced colors in save()
Validate GIF dimensions, size, frames, and duration for Slack
limitations: Does not include pre-made graphics or animation templates
Does not post or upload GIFs to Slack
Text rendering uses the Pillow default font only
Requires Pillow, imageio, and numpy to run

use_cases.title: Custom emoji loop
use_cases.description: Create a short branded emoji GIF that stays under Slack limits

use_cases.title: Style test animation
use_cases.description: Prototype a color and motion concept with easing helpers

use_cases.title: Automated validation
use_cases.description: Check existing GIFs for Slack size and dimension rules

prompt_templates.title: Simple emoji bounce
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a 128x128 emoji GIF of a yellow ball bouncing for 2 seconds at 12 fps. Use simple shapes and keep colors under 48.

prompt_templates.title: Looping message GIF
prompt_templates.prompt: Make a 480x480 looping GIF of a star spinning with a soft gradient background. Use 20 fps and keep file size small.

prompt_templates.title: Optimized tiny file
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate an emoji GIF under 300 KB. Use 10 fps, 48 colors, and remove duplicate frames if needed.

prompt_templates.title: Advanced easing choreography
prompt_templates.prompt: Animate a heart that pulses, slides in with back easing, then fades out. Use interpolate with ease_out and back_out for timing.

output_examples.input: Make a small Slack emoji GIF of a blinking eye
output: 48 colors with global palette for smaller size
Frame timings tuned for a smooth blink loop

best_practices: Start with 128x128 and 10 to 15 fps for emoji GIFs
Use fewer colors and remove near-duplicate frames to reduce size
Validate final GIF dimensions and size before sharing
anti_patterns: Using high resolution frames for emoji GIFs
Leaving duplicate frames in long loops
Relying on emoji fonts for critical visuals

faq.question: What tools is this compatible with?
faq.answer: It uses Pillow, imageio, and numpy, so it works in standard Python environments.

faq.question: What limits does it enforce for Slack?
faq.answer: It checks dimensions and reports size, frames, and duration for emoji and message GIFs.

faq.question: Can it integrate with Slack directly?
faq.answer: No, it generates files only. Upload to Slack is handled separately.

faq.question: Does it send my data anywhere?
faq.answer: No. It processes files locally using the installed Python libraries.

faq.question: What if validation fails?
faq.answer: Review the size and dimensions, then reduce frames, colors, or dimensions and try again.

faq.question: How does it compare to generic GIF tools?
faq.answer: It adds Slack-specific sizing guidance, validation, and animation helpers.
